actions.name: Get version details
actions.description: Gets detailed information about a specified version of the Identity API.

actions.name: Get extension details
actions.description:
Gets detailed information for a specified extension.
 Specify the extension alias in the URI.

actions.name: Authenticate for admin API
actions.description:
Authenticates and generates a token.
 
 A REST interface provides client authentication by using the
 POST method with v2.0/tokens as the path.
 Include a payload of credentials in the body.
 
 
 The Identity API is a RESTful web service. It is the entry
 point to all service APIs. To access the Identity API, you
 must know its URL.
 
 
 Each REST request against the Identity Service requires the
 X-Auth-Token header. Clients obtain this token
 and the URL endpoints for other service APIs by supplying
 their valid credentials to the authentication service.
 
 
 If the authentication token has expired, this call returns the
 HTTP 401 status code.
 
 
 If the token specified in the request body has expired, this
 call returns the HTTP 404 status code.
 
 
 The Identity API treats expired tokens as no longer valid
 tokens.
 
 
 The deployment determines how long expired tokens are stored.

actions.name: Validate token
actions.description:
Validates a token and confirms that it belongs to a specified
 tenant.
 Returns the permissions relevant to a particular client. Valid tokens are in the
 /tokens/{tokenId} path. A user should expect an itemNotFound
 (404) fault for a token that is not valid.

belongsTo.description:
Validates that a token has the specified
 tenant in scope, for performance. Valid tokens
 are in the /tokens/{tokenId}
 path. If the token is not valid, this call
 returns the HTTP itemNotFound
 (404) status code.

actions.name: Validate token (admin)
actions.description:
Validates a token and confirms that it belongs to a specified
 tenant, for performance.

belongsTo.description:
Validates that a token has the specified
 tenant in scope, for performance. Valid tokens
 are in the /tokens/{tokenId}
 path. If the token is not valid, this call
 returns the HTTP itemNotFound
 (404) status code.

actions.name: List endoints for token
actions.description: Lists the endpoints associated with a specified token.

actions.name: Get user information by name
actions.description:
Gets detailed information about a specified user by user
 name.

userId.description:
The ID of the user for which you want to perform the
 request.

actions.name: Get user information by ID
actions.description:
Gets detailed information about a specified user by user
 ID.

actions.name: List user global roles
actions.description:
Lists global roles for a specified user. Excludes tenant
 roles.

X-Auth-Token.description:
A valid
 authentication token for an administrative user.

actions.name: List tenants
actions.description:
Lists all tenants.
 
 
 GET /v2.0/tenants HTTP/1.1
Host: identity.api.openstack.org
Content-Type: application/json
X-Auth-Token: fa8426a0-8eaf-4d22-8e13-7c1b16a9370c
Accept: application/json

actions.name: Get tenant information by name
actions.description:
Gets detailed information about a specified tenant by
 name.

X-Auth-Token.description:
A valid
 authentication token for an administrative user.

actions.name: Get tenant information by ID
actions.description: Gets detailed information about a specified tenant by ID.

X-Auth-Token.description:
A valid
 authentication token for an administrative user.

actions.name: List roles for user
actions.description:
Lists roles for a specified user on a specified tenant. Excludes
 global roles.
